content:
The Garlic and Parmesan variation will add a delightful savory twist to the lemon rosemary shortbread cookies. Here's a suggestion for the amount of garlic and Parmesan to add:

**Garlic:**

* 1-2 cloves of garlic, minced (depending on your personal taste)
* Mix the minced garlic with the softened butter before creaming it with the sugar to ensure even distribution of the garlic flavor

**Parmesan:**

* 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (freshly grated is best)
* Add the Parmesan cheese to the dry ingredients (flour, confectioners' sugar, and salt) and mix well

Remember, you can always adjust the amount of garlic and Parmesan to your taste preferences. If you're unsure, start with a smaller amount and add more to taste.

Some tips to keep in mind:

* Use high-quality Parmesan cheese for the best flavor.
* Fresh garlic is essential for this recipe. If you're using jarred garlic, try to use a high-quality brand.
* Be gentle when mixing the garlic with the butter to avoid overpowering the other ingredients.
* If you're concerned about the garlic flavor being too strong, you can reduce the amount or omit it from the dough and instead sprinkle some minced garlic on top of the cookies before baking.

Now, go ahead and give the Garlic and Parmesan variation a try!
